alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 1:09PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern St. Clair County through 215 PM EDT... At 109 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Memphis, or 7 miles northwest of Richmond, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Emmett around 120 PM EDT. Yale around 135 PM EDT. Lakeport around 150 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include North Street, Goodells, Brockway, Smiths Creek, Wadhams, Riley Center, Allenton, Avoca, Blaine and Jeddo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
